sense.name: direct someone to do something with emphasis
sense.commentary: NOTE: Contrast with sense number 2, not necessarily a prohibition.
sense.examples: The doctor enjoined a strict diet. The nurse enjoined to keep the patient as still as possible.

sense.name: LEGAL: prohibit, prevent; issue an injunction, forbid action
sense.commentary: NOTE: All legal uses of enjoin should be tagged with this sense.
sense.examples: The district court permanently enjoined the Youngs from irrigating their property. A federal judge enjoined the state from enforcing a law that would ban the sale of violent video games to minors.
